metadata.case_name: Raja Jagannath Baksh Singh v. State of Uttar Pradesh

facts.text: Petitioner Raja Jagannath Baksh Singh was a Taluqdar of Rehwan Estate in District Rai Bareli. Under U.P. Zamindari Abolition and Land Reforms Act (U.P. Act 1 of 1951), his Zamindari property vested in the State Government, and groves and other agricultural land were left with him as a Bhumidar.
In 1957, U.P. Legislature passed U.P. Large Land Holdings Tax Act No. XXXI of 1957 (the Act).
Under section 7(2) of the Act, petitioner served with notice along with provisional assessment of annual value for year 1365 Fasli. Similar notices for 1366 and 1367 Fasli.
Petitioner filed returns objecting to annual value calculated by assessing authority.
After notices for 1365 and 1366 Fasli, petitioner filed writ petitions in Allahabad High Court (Nos. 3146 of 1958 and 1354 of 1959) challenging validity of notices and Act as ultra vires.
Allahabad High Court dismissed writs on 12th October 1959, upholding Act as valid (Oudh Sugar Mills Ltd., Hargaon v. State of U.P., A.I.R. 1960 All. 136).
Petitioner obtained certificate to appeal to Supreme Court but failed to deposit security for printing charges; certificate cancelled on 9th August 1960.

On 22nd November 1960, petitioner filed three petitions in Supreme Court under Art. 32: Nos. 325, 326, 327 of 1960 against notices for 1365, 1366, 1367 Fasli. Petitions 325 and 326 dismissed on res judicata.

This petition (No. 327/1960) concerns assessment for 1367 Fasli: notice under s.7(2), provisional tax Rs.15,838/92 nP on 1152A-11B-1B holding valued at Rs.44,464/88 nP; final recoverable tax Rs.14,882/86 nP.
Section 28 of Act repeals U.P. Agricultural Income Tax Act, 1948. Act repealed by s.45 of U.P. Imposition of Ceiling on Land Holdings Act 1961 (1 of 1961) as from 30th June 1961.
Petitioner's gross income Rs.1,07,362; cost of cultivation not exceeding 40% (Rs.42,000); net income Rs.65,362; tax Rs.14,882/86 nP.

legal_issues.text: Whether U.P. Legislature competent to pass the Act under Entry 49 List II ('taxes on lands and buildings') as 'lands' includes agricultural lands.
Whether Act violates Articles 14, 19(1)(f) and 31 of Constitution.
Whether rates fixed by State Government under s.5(1) invalid for non-compliance with section.
Whether s.5(1) and charging section contravene Arts.14 and 19(1)(f) by leaving unfettered discretion to State Government.

petitioner_arguments.text: U.P. Legislature not competent to pass Act as 'lands' in Entry 49 List II excludes agricultural lands.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Entry 49 List II, 7th Schedule; Entry 46 List II

petitioner_arguments.text: Multiple prescribed by State under s.5(1) invalid as not different for districts/classes of land; 'may' means 'must'.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Section 5(1) U.P. Large Land Holdings Tax Act

petitioner_arguments.text: s.5(1) and charging section violate Arts.14, 19(1)(f), 31 by unfettered discretion.
Act confiscatory: 3/5th income for production costs, only 1/5th net; or 1/4 seeds, 1/4 irrigation, 1/4 ploughing/labour, 1/5 rent.

respondent_arguments.text: U.P. Legislature competent; Act does not violate Arts.14,19,31; rates fixed per s.5(1).
Petitioner's gross income Rs.1,07,362; costs <=40% (Rs.42,000); net Rs.65,362; tax Rs.14,882 not confiscatory. Rent from Bhumidars low (~1%).

court_reasoning.text: Words in Constitution like 'lands' in Entry 49 List II receive liberal construction; includes agricultural lands. Entry 46 covers agricultural income tax, not excluding ag. lands from Entry 49.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Act imposes tax on land holdings, within competence.

court_reasoning.text: 'May' in s.5(1) discretionary, not mandatory; notification complies by varying multiples for groves, Kumaun etc.

Taxing statutes challengeable under Part III if violate fundamental rights. No violation of Art.14 (rational classification on annual value >Rs.3600, >30 acres); Art.19(1)(f) (procedure provided, discretion guided); Art.31(1) met by valid law, Art.31(2) inapplicable.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Scheme taxes large holdings on rent-based annual value.

court_reasoning.text: Not confiscatory; petitioner's figures disputed, net income substantial post-costs; no constitutional infirmity or colourable legislation.
court_reasoning.key_observation: High tax alone not ground to strike down unless fraud proven.

holdings.text: U.P. Legislature competent under Entry 49 List II; 'lands' includes agricultural lands.

outcome.summary: Supreme Court dismissed the writ petition upholding validity of U.P. Large Land Holdings Tax Act, 1957 and assessment for 1367 Fasli; Act within legislative competence, no violation of Arts.14,19,31; not confiscatory.

key_quotes.text: the words 'lands' cannot be interpreted in the manner suggested... The word 'lands' is wide enough to include all lands, whether agricultural or not.
key_quotes.speaker: court

key_quotes.text: the word 'may' in the context cannot mean 'shall' or 'must'.
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Rejects mandatory differing multiples under s.5(1).

key_quotes.text: a taxing statute cannot be challenged merely on the ground that it imposes an unreasonably high burden... unless colourable exercise proven.
key_quotes.speaker: court
